# First-Time Contributor Issues

Welcome! This directory contains **10 fabulous first-time contributor issues** designed to help newcomers get started with cmdai.

## Quick Links

- [FIRST_TIME_CONTRIBUTORS.md](../../FIRST_TIME_CONTRIBUTORS.md) - Your starting guide!
- [CONTRIBUTING.md](../../CONTRIBUTING.md) - Development workflow
- [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](../../CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) - Community guidelines

## The 10 Fabulous Issues

### üé® UI & Fun
1. **[Shiba ASCII Art](01-shiba-ascii-art.md)** ‚≠ê
   - Add our adorable Shiba mascot to the welcome message
   - Perfect for: Dog/cat lovers, UI enthusiasts, anyone who wants terminals to be fun

2. **[Loading Animations](08-loading-animations.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê
   - Create beautiful loading spinners and progress bars
   - Perfect for: UI/UX designers, animation lovers, visual thinkers

### üõ°Ô∏è Safety & Security
3. **[Windows PowerShell Safety](02-windows-powershell-safety.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê
   - Expand dangerous command detection for Windows
   - Perfect for: Security-conscious developers, Windows power users

4. **[Interactive Safety Tutorial](03-interactive-safety-tutorial.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê
   - Teach users about command safety interactively
   - Perfect for: Educators, technical writers, safety advocates

5. **[Terminal Education Mode](07-terminal-education-mode.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê
   - Explain what generated commands actually do
   - Perfect for: Seasoned users helping newcomers, educators

9. **[Command Similarity Detection](09-command-similarity-detection.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
   - Suggest safer alternatives for risky commands
   - Perfect for: Algorithm enthusiasts, safety-focused developers, ML learners

### ü§ñ AI & Agents
4. **[Decision Tree Visualization](04-decision-tree-visualization.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
   - Show how cmdai decides which command to generate
   - Perfect for: Decision tree enthusiasts, data structure lovers, agent builders

5. **[Command History Tracking](05-command-history-tracking.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
   - Track commands with safety scores and analytics
   - Perfect for: Data-minded developers, agent builders, analytics enthusiasts

### ‚ö° Integrations
6. **[MCP Claude Code Integration](06-mcp-claude-code-integration.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
   - Create an MCP skill for Claude Code
   - Perfect for: Claude Code power users, MCP enthusiasts, integration specialists

### üõ†Ô∏è Community & Curation
10. **[Community Tool Library](10-community-tool-library.md)** ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
    - Build a curated database of terminal tools with safety ratings
    - Perfect for: Tool curators, knowledge organizers, community builders

## Difficulty Levels

- ‚≠ê **Easy**: Great for absolute beginners
- ‚≠ê‚≠ê **Easy-Medium**: Some Rust/terminal knowledge helpful
- ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê **Medium**: Intermediate skills required
- ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê **Medium-Hard**: Advanced challenge for experienced developers

## How to Claim an Issue

1. **Read the issue file** that interests you
2. **Comment on the corresponding GitHub issue** saying "I'd like to work on this!"
3. **Wait for assignment** (usually < 24 hours)
4. **Follow the implementation guide** in the issue file
5. **Ask questions** in the issue thread - we're here to help!
6. **Submit your PR** when ready

## Creating GitHub Issues

To create these as actual GitHub issues, use the following template:

```bash
# For each issue file, create a GitHub issue with:
# - Title from the issue file's H1
# - Labels from the issue metadata
# - Content from the issue file
# - Link back to this directory

# Example for issue #1:
gh issue create \
  --title "üêï Add Shiba-themed ASCII Art to Welcome Message" \
  --label "good-first-issue,first-time-contributor,ui,fun,caro-the-shiba" \
  --body-file .github/first-time-issues/01-shiba-ascii-art.md
```

## Contributing New First-Timer Issues

Have an idea for another great first-timer issue? We'd love it!

1. Follow the template structure from existing issues
2. Include:
   - Clear vision and motivation
   - Step-by-step implementation guide
   - Acceptance criteria
   - Resources and examples
   - Encouragement and support messaging
3. Submit a PR adding your issue to this directory
4. We'll review and create the GitHub issue

## Project Philosophy

Our first-time issues are designed to be:

- **Educational**: You'll learn while contributing
- **Impactful**: Real features that help real users
- **Supported**: We provide detailed guidance and patient code review
- **Diverse**: Something for every skill level and interest
- **Welcoming**: No judgment, only encouragement

## Questions?

- **General questions**: [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/wildcard/cmdai/discussions)
- **Stuck on an issue**: Comment on the issue thread
- **Need encouragement**: Read [FIRST_TIME_CONTRIBUTORS.md](../../FIRST_TIME_CONTRIBUTORS.md)
